page.title: 19HUTTON MARR SCHOOL CLOSURE 2
page.content: The children were asked to record their views as to the closure of their school. On balance, most looked forward to their new schools, but some expressed specific regrets. One said "I am both happy and sad - I will miss Miss Wilson (Headteacher) and the school." The division of the children between two other area schools caused some wry pleasure, in that old 'enemies' would be elsewhere. The staff of the school, while not being able to make constructive plans for their own careers while decisions were pending, have succeeded in sustaining an atmosphere which has remained constructive and forward- looking. The rural community accepts only with regret the end of nearly 250 years of teaching in this area, always supported by the local people.
